content:
• Wednesday, December 20, 2017
  • VERI

    Veritone +9% after acquiring advanced data science firm Atigeo

    • Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) +9.3% after-hours as it agrees to acquire Atigeo Corp. and its advanced data analytics software and related intellectual property for an undisclosed sum.
    • Atigeo's technology includes a system designed to process large amounts of unstructured data using rules-based processing systems on the fly.
    • Several key Atigeo employees, including chief scientist Wolf Kohn, will join VERI following the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 PM | 15 Comments
  • EURN

    WSJ: Euronav nears deal to merge with tanker rival Gener8

    • Euronav (NYSE:EURN) is near a merger deal with rival oil tanker owner Gener8 Maritime (NYSE:GNRT), with an agreement possibly reached as soon as this week, WSJ reports.
    • EURN, which is listed on the NYSE and in Belgium, has a market value of more than $1B.
    • GNRT, with a ~$360M market cap and partly owned by Oaktree Capital (NYSE:OAK), was in merger talks with Frontline earlier this year but no deal was reached.
    • EURN -4.3%, GNRT +9.8% after-hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:21 PM | 35 Comments
  • AEZS

    FDA OKs Aeterna Zentaris' Macrilen for diagnosis of adult growth hormone deficiency; shares up 53% after hours

    • Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) is up 53% after hours on robust volume in response to the FDA approval of Macrilen (macimorelin) to be used in the diagnosis of adult growth hormone deficiency (AGHD).
    • Macrilen stimulates the secretion of growth hormone from the pituitary gland. Stimulated levels are measured in four blood samples over 90 minutes after ingesting the ghrelin agonist.
    • The company estimates that ~60K tests for suspected AGHD are performed each year in the U.S., Canada and Europe.
    • Commercial launch in the U.S. will commence next quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM | 3 Comments
  • PCG

    PG&E suspends dividends, citing potential fire-related liabilities

    • PG&E (NYSE:PCG) -9.3% after-hours as it suspends its quarterly dividend beginning with Q4, citing "uncertainty related to causes and potential liabilities associated with the extraordinary October 2017 northern California wildfires."
    • The Pacific Gas and Electric utility also will suspend the dividend on its preferred stock, beginning Jan. 31.
    • The company notes California is one of the only states in the country in which courts have ruled that if a utility’s equipment is found to have been a substantial cause of damage in an event such as a wildfire - even if the utility has followed established inspection and safety rules - it still may be liable for related property damages and attorney fees.
    • “We fully recognize the importance of dividends and intend to revisit the issue as we get more clarity," the company says.
    • Edison International (NYSE:EIX), experiencing its own fire-related uncertainties, -3.5% after-hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 154 Comments
  • COMM

    CommScope appoints new COO

    • CommScope (NASDAQ:COMM) appoints Morgan Kurk as COO and executive VP effective January 1.
    • Kurk was the CTO and replaces COO Randy Crenshaw, who will retire at the end of the year.   
    • CommScope shares are down 0.4% aftermarket.    
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): Q3 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $2.96B (flat Y/Y) beats by $60M.
    • Shares +7.1%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 21 Comments
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris trading halted pending news

    • Nasdaq has suspended trading in Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) pending the release of news.
    • December 30 is the FDA's action date for its resubmitted marketing application for Macrilen for growth hormone deficiency.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 8 Comments
  • NBL

    Noble Energy moves higher as CEO Stover buys $500K in shares

    • Noble Energy (NBL +2.4%) is higher after Chairman, President and CEO David Stover disclosed the purchase of 19K shares on Monday for $500K, paying an average $26.31/share.
    • It was Stover’s first open-market purchase since being named CEO in October 2014 and is his first such buy on record going back to February 2004 when he was VP of business development, according to Ed Lin Barron's.
    • Last month, executive VP of operations Gary Willingham paid $780K for 30K shares; Barron's says the two purchases are the first NBL insider buys since 2015, and the first by executives on record going back to 2003.
    • Yesterday, Seaport Global analyst Mike Kelly upgraded NBL to Buy from Neutral, praising the company's $3B-plus in divestitures over the past year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 2 Comments

  • Tax bill opens up ANWR for drilling

    • Attached to just-passed tax reform is a provision opening up the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge to oil and gas drilling, a dream of the energy industry since before many reading this news item were born.
    • The area contains an estimated 10.4B barrels of oil, says Alaska Senator Lisa Murkowski.
    • The major averages are flat today, but the XLE is up 1.5%.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, UGA, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, UHN, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, FTXN, JHME, ERYY, ERGF
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 87 Comments
  • SEP

    Spectra Energy Partners -2% as Barclays downgrades

    • Spectra Energy Partners (SEP -2.1%) is downgraded to Equal Weight from Overweight with a $46 price target, trimmed from $49, at Barclays, which says SEP may depend on dropdowns upon further assessment of the potential impact of an IDR buy-in and the limited visibility for organic growth opportunities.
    • SEP said last month that it had received an offer from Enbridge to convert all of ENB's IDR and economic GP interests in SEP into a fixed number of SEP common units; while the elimination of IDRs should lower the cost of capital over the longer-term, Barclays believes the benefits may be somewhat offset by dropdowns that likely will be executed to continue growth due to the limited visibility of future organic growth projects at SEP after a multi-year period of heavy spending.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 13 Comments
  • QIWI

    Qiwi pops higher on blog blockchain mention

    • Russia-based payment services company Qiwi (NASDAQ:QIWI) spikes more than 2% after iBankCoin notes the company has plenty of crypto exposure. The stock, though, hasn't received nearly the sort of investor interest or major stock price pop of names like Riot Blockchain (NASDAQ:RIOT), Longfin (OTCPK:LFIN), or Crypto Co. (OTC:CRCW).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 14 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: ALO +15%. IO +13%.MCF +11%. GTE +10%. SCHN +10%.
    • Losers: SAEX -17%. CHKR -9%. SNMX -8%. TMQ -7%. WLB -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 8 Comments

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 PM

    • Gainers: NETE +269%. OPNT +30%.MTSL +30%. JRJC +24%. ELTK +17%.
    • Losers: CCIH -38%. APDN -26%. BVSN -13%. TCCO -10%. IFON -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • PENN

    Barclays positive on Penn-Pinnacle deal

    • Barclays issues a positive note on the impact of Penn National Gaming's (PENN +5.4%) acquisition of Pinnacle Entertainment on the two main players as well as Gaming and Leisure Properties (GLPI -0.8%) and Boyd Gaming (BYD -2.1%).
    • The firm lifts the price target on PENN to $36 from $30, while the PT on BYD goes to $35 from $29 and GLPI is bumpted to a $47 PT from $44.
    • Penn and GLPI are both rated at Overweight by analyst Felicia Hendrix due to immediate upside from the casino property reset.
    • Yesterday, Union Gaming issued a similar summary of the deal.
    • Previously: Union Gaming sees winners all around from Penn-Pinnacle deal (Dec. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • GBTC

    North Korea suspected in latest Bitcoin theft

    • Seoul-based crypto exchange Youbit collapsed yesterday after cyberattackers made off with a chunk of its assets.
    • North Korea's fingerprints are on the attack, investigators tell the WSJ. That state was also behind a hack of this same exchange (then operating under a different name) in April.
    • "Much of the cryptocurrency system is highly vulnerable," says a cybersecurity expert. "Because this world is moving so fast and now it’s so lucrative, it’s really exactly what a cybercriminal like North Korea is looking for.”
    • Previously: South Korean crypto exchange collapses; BTC slides under $18K (Dec. 19)
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:UBIA, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, PRELF, OTCPK:BLKCF, OTC:CRCW, COINB, OTCPK:LFIN
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 74 Comments
  • BIDU

    Baidu will help build AI city, research hub

    • Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) and the Xiongan New Area’s administrative committee will collaborate on a new smart city with intelligent transport, conversational AI features, and a cloud computing infrastructure.
    • Xiongan New Area is located in China’s Hebei province.
    • Baidu and the Hebei government will also jointly establish a national AI research lab. 
    • In other news, Baidu announces that its smartphone screen recorder app Du Recorder has topped 35M users.   
    • Baidu shares are down 1.1%.    
    • Previously: Venture capital deals of the week (Dec. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • FAT

    FAT Brands starts on international expansion path

    • FAT Brands (FAT -3%) announces that it plans to enter Japan by opening a restaurant in Tokyo next April.
    • The company says the launch in Japan marks the beginning of its international expansion strategy.
    • FAT Brands expects that several additional agreements will be executed in 2018 for the Fatburger, Buffalo’s Express and Ponderosa & Bonanza Steakhouses chains.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • NBY

    NovaBay Pharma up 19% ahead of planned $12M equity offering

    • Thinly traded nano cap NovaBay Pharmaceuticals (NBY +19%) is up on 30% higher volume, albeit on light turnover of 13K shares. No particular news accounts for the action, although five days ago it filed a prospectus for a $12M stock offering.
    • At the end of Q3, it had $6.1M in cash and equivalents while operations consumed $3.3M year-to-date through September.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: JTPY +37%. SIEB +21%.LEJU +8%. IIPR +6%. XIN +5%.
    • Losers: CCCR-OLD -32%. PMTS -9%. GROW -8%. RCG -7%. OPHC -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • BIIB

    Biogen adds to recent up move; shares ahead 2%

    • Biogen (BIIB +2.2%) is up, albeit on lower-than-normal volume, adding to its upward trend. Shares have rallied almost 10% in a month.
    • Yesterday, it announced a new collaboration with Ionis aimed at new candidates to treat spinal muscular atrophy.
    • The biggest future catalyst is late-stage data on Alzheimer's candidate aducanumab. Two Phase 3s, EMERGE and ENGAGE, are currently recruiting patients.
    • In August, the company reported encouraging data from an early-stage extension study.
    • Aducanumab is a human recombinant monoclonal antibody derived from a library of B cells collected from healthy elderly subjects with no signs of cognitive impairment. It is being developed under a global deal with Neurimmune inked in November 2007.
    • Previously: Biogen's Alzheimer's candidate aducanumab shows long-term treatment effect in extension phase of early-stage study (Aug. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: NETE +334%. NXTD +63%. FTFT +48%. OPNT +34%. JRJC +32%. SSC-OLD +30%. ORPN +29%. MTSL +23%. CBIO +23%. CNET +18%.
    • Losers: CCCR-OLD -33%. CCIH -31%. APDN -21%. PFNX -17%. SAEX -16%. LENS -14%. PIXY -14%.OTC:EGLT -10%.IDN -10%.TCCO -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 8 Comments
  • NBR

    Nabors to sell three operational offshore rigs for $83M

    • Nabors Industries (NBR +1.7%) agrees to sell three operating offshore jack-up rigs to ADES International Holding for $83M in cash and stock.
    • The drilling units to be sold are three ultra-shallow rigs that have been in continuous service for more than 10 years, and all recently were refurbished.
    • The names of the rigs are not disclosed but an offshore broker believes the rigs are contract with Saudi Aramco
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 8 Comments
  • AA

    Alcoa +6% after Credit Suisse issues second analyst upgrade in two days

    • Alcoa (AA +5.7%) jumps more than 5% after Credit Suisse upgrades shares to Outperform from Neutral with a $61 price target, up from $42, saying the aluminum market is set to tighten next year and that higher prices should help the stock rise.
    • Analyst Curt Woodworth writes that although aluminum winter cuts disappointed, the alumina and bauxite closures helped to push price forecasts higher; he also says Alcoa's valuation is "compelling" with catalysts ahead, as the company is about to become "a capital return story."
    • AA shares have surged 15% this week, as Morgan Stanley also upgraded its outlook for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 5 Comments
  • ORIG

    Reuters: Ocean Rig prepares to explore sale

    • Ocean Rig UDW (ORIG +3.1%) jumps following a Reuters report that the offshore driller is preparing to explore a sale amid pressure from some of its largest shareholders to review its strategic alternatives.
    • ORIG has interviewed investment banks in recent weeks to appoint a financial adviser that will help it explore a sale, according to the report.
    • Within a month of exiting Chapter 15 bankruptcy in September, ORIG’s largest shareholder, the Elliott Management hedge fund, called for the company to review strategic options and said it would seek the support of other top shareholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 5 Comments
  • HMNY

    Theater blockbuster: MoviePass tops 1M subscribers

    • There's something pretty dramatic going on with movie theater attendance that's becoming harder to ignore. Today, MoviePass announced that it passed 1M paying subscribers. The business that is majority-owned by Helios and Matheson Analytics (HMNY +4%) hit the 1M subs mark faster than Hulu (NYSE:DIS), Netflix (NFLX -0.1%) or Spotify.
    • While plenty of investors are debating the HMNY numbers and model on Seeking Alpha, there's also the question of what kind of tailwind AMC Entertainment (AMC -1.3%), Regal Entertainment (RGC +0.1%), Marcus Corporation (MCS +0.9%), Reading International (RDI +0.2%) and Cinemark Holdings (CNK +1.3%) will catch from the 1M-member MoviePass army. One negative is that MoviePass limits subscribers to standard screenings, a potential drag on 3D and premium dine-in traffic.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 118 Comments
  • GE

    General Electric slumps to six-year low below $17.50

    • General Electric (GE -0.8%) slides to a fresh six-year low, capping a 45% plunge since the start of this year and a 27% slide since September.
    • Although Wolfe Research technical analyst Rob Ginsberg calls GE "dramatically oversold," he also says its chart is "one of the uglier long-term formations in the market today" and sees $15 as the place where the stock will try to make a stand.
    • GE bear John Inch at Deutsche Bank sees the potential loss of board member Ed Garden of Trian Partners, which owns just 0.8% and might exit its GE position if the stock continues to struggle: "We also presume that Garden would likely be forced to step down from the GE board... Were there not other equally qualified candidates with more prospective longevity for the position vs. a hedge fund executive whose firm owns just 80 bps of GE’s shares?"
    • Goldman's Joe Ritchie recently advised staying away from GE without more evidence of a recovery in cash flows and end markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 153 Comments
  • APDN

    Applied DNA Sciences secures $4.8M private capital raise; shares down 25%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Applied DNA Sciences (APDN -25.2%) slumps on a 6x surge in volume in response to the pricing of its direct sale of stock and warrants to certain institutional investors.
    • Under the terms of the agreement, it will sell 2.735M shares of common stock with accompanying warrants at a combined price of $1.75. Each share sold will have an associated five-year warrant to purchase one share of common at $2.00.
    • Net proceeds will be ~$4.2M. Closing date is December 22.
    • Yesterday's close was $2.22.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • OPNT

    Opiant to receive 90% of Narcan payments directly from Adapt Pharma starting next quarter; shares ahead 32%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Opiant Pharmaceuticals (OPNT +32.1%) is up on more than triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 238K shares, in response to its announcement that, beginning in Q1 2018, it will receive 90% of NARCAN royalty and milestone payments directly from distribution partner Adapt Pharma.
    • In turn, Opiant's royalty and milestone payments due to SWK Holdings will be reduced to 10%. SWK has already been paid $26.25M per its agreement with Opiant.
    • Opiant will record royalty revenue received for the period ending December 31 in its 10-K for the period August 1 - December 31, 2017.
    • NARCAN is the only FDA-approved naloxone nasal spray for the emergency treatment of opioid overdose.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • MERC

    Mercer International higher after pulling off financing move

    • Mercer International (NASDAQ:MERC) announces that it completed a $300M private offering of 5.500% senior notes due in 2026.
    • The company says proceeds from the offering will be used to help redeem $300M in principal amount of a 7.750% senior notes issue due in 2022.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • YPF

    YPF is top LatAm energy stock pick at Goldman, citing cheap valuation

    • YPF (YPF +1.9%) remains the top stock pick among Latin American oil producers as higher oil prices suggest the company can meet its 2018-22 strategic plan targets, Goldman Sachs says, reiterating its Buy recommendation and raising its ADR price target to $32.
    • The firm says YPF’s power, nat gas and fuel distribution segments are excessively discounted, suggesting any strategy to improve such assets’ visibility could unlock further value.
    • YPF is transitioning to become an integrated energy play, with generation capacity of 1.6 GW already installed and 400 MW under construction, which Goldman says is under-appreciated by investors based on YPF’s current valuations.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 1 Comment

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:10 am

    • Gainers: ORPN +48%. GALT +21%. CBIO +21%. ADXS +10%. MGEN +9%.
    • Losers: LENS -12%. PFNX -11%. SRNE -9%. MNKD -8%. OTC:EGLT -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 2 Comments
  • CIFS

    Muddy Waters takes aim at China Internet Financial Services

    • The company is a "King Zero," says Muddy Waters. "Just another worthless China fraud ... We believe zero to almost none of CIFS’s purported business is real."
    • All of the supposed borrowers to which CIFS has said it made loans to appear to be a "sham counterparty," says MW.
    • Claiming to turn a commoditized business model into an "overnight juggernaut" with gross margins of 97% and net margins topping 70% is "too good to be true."
    • Shares - which peaked at about $60 a few weeks back (from $12 earlier in the year) - continue to slide, down 4.25% to $36.70.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 6 Comments
  • TELL

    WSJ: Saudi Aramco has held talks with Tellurian, other U.S. energy firms

    • Tellurian (TELL +3.2%) takes off following a WSJ report that Saudi Aramco has held initial talks about either taking a stake in the company or agreeing to buy some of its gas in the future.
    • The talks have not reached an advanced stage, and the Saudis have talked to other, undisclosed U.S. companies about natural gas export deals, and has inquired about acquiring assets in the Permian and Eagle Ford basins, according to the report.
    • Aramco owns refineries around the world, including the U.S., but does not produce any oil and gas outside Saudi Arabia’s borders, so any deal to acquire U.S. oil and gas production assets would mark a watershed moment for Saudi Arabia.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 18 Comments
  • ORPN

    Bioblast Pharma up 32%, triggers volatility halt

    • Trading in thinly traded nano cap Bioblast Pharma (ORPN +31.5%) has been suspended due to volatility. Shares have rallied almost 60% since last week.
    • Tomorrow, the company will host an Annual and Extraordinary Meeting of Shareholders.
    • At the end of September, it had $4.1M in cash while operations consumed $5.8M over the first three quarters of this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • AMBS

    Amarantus Bio nabs Japanese patent covering MANF for Parkinson's; shares up 31%

    • Nano cap Amarantus Bioscience Holdings (OTCPK:AMBS +31%) is up on increased volume in response to its announcement that subsidiary MANF Therapeutics has been awarded a patent from the Japan Patent Office covering the use of MANF (mesencephalic-astrocyte-derived neurotrophic factor) for Parkinson's disease.
    • MANF is a naturally occurring protein in the body that plays a key role in reducing and preventing cell death in response to injury or disease.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • MU

    Stifel reexamines NAND market after Micron earnings (update)

    • Stifel reexamines the NAND market after Micron’s (NASDAQ:MU) earnings and thinks Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX) has the best exposure to Micron on both NAND and DRAM.
    • Stifel believes Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) and KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC) have increased exposure to Micron through 3D NAND while FormFactor (NASDAQ:FORM) is a leading probe card supplier to Micron.
    • Ratings: Lam Research, Buy; Applied Materials, Buy; KLA-Tencor, Buy; FormFactor, Buy.
    • Lam Research shares are up 1.6%.
    • Applied Materials shares are up 0.6%.
    • KLA-Tencor shares are up 0.3%.
    • Micron shares are up 3.4%.
    • Previously: Micron +3.1% after Q1 beats, upside EPS and NAND guidance (Dec. 19)
    • Update: Removed current prices that were listed as price targets.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 50 Comments
  • JACK

    Jefferies skittish on Jack in the Box after Qdoba deal

    • Jefferies is no longer a fan of Jack in the Box (JACK -2.4%) after the company unloaded Qdoba to Apollo Global Management.
    • The investment firm sees a tough track for the restaurant chain due to fast-food pricing pressure and wage inflation.
    • Jefferies lowers JACK to a Hold rating and drops its price target to $100 from $120.
    • Previously: Jack in the Box sells Qdoba to Apollo Global (Dec. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • SAEX

    SAExploration enters restructuring support agreement

    • SAExploration (SAEX -15.2%) sinks after announcing it entered Into a comprehensive restructuring support agreement with bondholders who agree to exchange their existing notes for a combination of common stock, convertible preferred stock and warrants.
    • SAEX expects implementation of the agreement would eliminate $87M in principal amount of outstanding debt and reduce annual interest payments by $8.7M..
    • SAEX also says it reached an agreement in principle to increase the face amount of its revolver to $20M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • SOHU

    Sohu.com offering share block

    • Sohu.com (NASDAQ:SOHU) will reportedly offer a 1.16M share block at $44 to $45.64 per share.
    • Sohu shares are down 2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • ATOS

    Atossa down 26% on private capital raise

    • Atossa Genetics (ATOS -26.3%) slumps on increased volume in response to its direct offering of ~5.3M shares of common stock for a total of $1.4M.
    • Buyers will also receive Class A and Class B warrants to purchase up to ~5.3M shares of common at $0.315.
    • The combined price for one share of stock and one Class A and one Class B warrant is $0.27.
    • Closing date is December 22.
    • Yesterday's close was $0.3119.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 5 Comments
  • NMRK

    BGC Partners up 1.7% after business update

    • Revenues and pretax adjusted earnings for Q4 are now seen at the high-end of previous guidance. This incorporates the outlook for just-IPO'd Newmark Group (NASDAQ:NMRK), whose revenues are expected to be more than half of BGCP's quarter.
    • The dividend is expected to be maintained at $0.18 per share.
    • BGC's Q4 results are expected to be released on Feb. 7.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Shares up 1.7%
    • Previously: Newmark prices IPO at $14, bottom of range (Dec. 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 20 Comments
  • KR

    Confidence in Kroger picks up

    • Kroger (KR +1.2%) shakes off another bear call as the grocery store chain continues to outperform in the face of some beaten-down expectations.
    • Wolfe Research lifts Kroger to Peer Perform from Underperform.
    • While Amazon's purchase of Whole Foods has dominated the conversation in the grocery store sector for six months, Kroger has been steadily increasing its digital and delivery business.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 26 Comments
  • CVM

    CEL-SCI down 4% on deals to sell ~1.3M common shares at $1.90

    • CEL-SCI (CVM -4.1%) slips on light volume on the heels of its disclosure that it has received subscription agreements from 19 investors for the purchase of 1,289,478 shares of common stock at $1.90 per share. Buyers will also receive warrants to purchase up to the same number of shares at $2.09.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 6 Comments
  • NAV

    Navistar tracks back after earnings rally

    • Navistar (NAV -3%) trades lower a day after the company posted Q4 results and rallied over 7%.
    • Yesterday, investors had their eyes on the strong revenue (+26% Y/Y to $2.6B on brisk demand for Class 6-8 trucks and buses) and guidance from Navistar management ("breakout" year expected), but today a downgrade from Gabelli is holding some weight.
    • Gabelli dropped Navistar to Hold from Buy due to valuation concerns.
    • Previously: Navistar EPS of $1.36 (Dec. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 2 Comments
  • CBIO

    Catalyst Bio prices stock offering at $9.50; shares ahead 6%

    • Catalyst Biosciences (CBIO +6.4%) prices its public offering of ~1.1M shares of common stock at $9.50 per share. Closing date is December 22.
    • Yesterday's close was $9.96.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • EGLT

    Egalet inks deal with investors to extend maturity of convertible debt in exchange for higher interest rate and warrants to buy 3.5M shares of stock; shares down 6%

    • Aimed at reducing its debt burden and cutting interest expenses, Egalet (OTC:EGLT -6%) inks exchange agreements with holders of its outstanding 5.50% senior convertible notes due April 1, 2020.
    • Under the terms of the contracts, the total principal amount outstanding will be reduced to $48.5M from $61.0M, including the issuance of $23.9M of new 6.5% convertible notes due December 31, 2024. The initial conversion rate is 749.6252 shares per $1,000 principal amount (~$1.33/share).
    • The company will issue a warrant to purchase 3.5M common shares in exchange for $36.4M principal amount of the 5.50% notes. The exercise price of the warrant is not provided.
    • Egalet says its annual interest payments will be reduced by ~$450K.

  • COINB

    Insider trading alleged after Bitcoin Cash blast-off

    • The introduction of Bitcoin Cash to the Coinbase (COINB) platform last night touched off one of the wilder sessions of trading in an already wild space.
    • BCH had already climbed about 50% in the session or two prior to the announcement, and then took off anew right after, necessitating Coinbase to halt trading after just a few minutes.
    • At issue, though, is the big run higher just prior to Coinbase's announcement, suggesting someone may have been front-running. Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong says there's "no indication of any wrongdoing at this time," but the company will be doing a full investigation.
    • That BCH was to be added to the Coinbase platform was no secret - only the timing was in question, as many expected it to be a January 2018 event.

  • GBTC

    Litecoin creator sells all his coins

    • "For the first time in 6+ years, I no longer own a single LTC," says Charlie Lee, the creator of what's often called the "silver" to Bitcoin's "gold."
    • The exit is about eliminating the appearance of conflicts, he says, noting he often gets excoriated for pumping the price, and sometimes even gets accused of shorting Litecoin.
    • Lee still plans to spend all of his time working on Litecoin, and when it succeeds, he'll still be rewarded, he says, just not from ownership of the coins.
    • The rally in Litecoin this year puts the move in Bitcoin to shame - Charlie Lee's baby is higher by nearly 9,000% Y/Y, including about a 5x move in just the last month.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:UBIA, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, PRELF, OTCPK:BLKCF, OTC:CRCW, COINB, OTCPK:LFIN

  • GIS

    Organic sales growth steady at General Mills

    • General Mills (NYSE:GIS) reports organic sales increased 1% in FQ2 on growth across all four segments.
    • The convenience stores and foodservice segment saw a three percentage point increase in volume and two percentage point gain in price/mix during the quarter.
    • Adjusted gross margin came in at 34.4% of sales vs. 36.8% a year ago and 35.4% consensus. Higher input costs and unfavorable trade expenses factored in.
    • The effective tax rate during the quarter was 35.9% vs. 32.8% a year ago.
    • Looking ahead, General Mills lifts its view on 2018 organic sales. The company now expects organic sales to be flat to down 1%, up from a prior view of a decline of 1% to 2%.
    • Shares of General Mills are up 1.22% in premarket action.
